tag.name: CHTML - dataLayer - Form - Abandonment
tag.notes: This custom script will assign event listeners to a targeted form on page via {{CJS - Form}}. If the form is interacted with (changed) but not submitted, then the user changes the page or the browser "unload" event gets triggered, the script will fire a dataLayer push for form abandonment. This script only targets a single form.

parameter.value:
<script>
(function() {
  try {
    // get gtm debug mode
    var db = {{Debug Mode}};
    // does browser support addEventListener
    if(typeof window.addEventListener != 'undefined') {
      // has gtm_custom_helper been setup already
      if(typeof window.gtm_custom_helper == 'undefined') {
        // create gtm_custom_helper and create functions
        window.gtm_custom_helper = {};
        // flag if the form has changed
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formChangeCall = function(){
          try {
            window.gtm_custom_helper.formChanged = true;
          } catch(err){};
        }
        // flag if the form has been submitted
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmitCall = function(){
          try {
            window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmit = true;
          } catch(err){};
        }
        // when the browser unloads check the flags and do a dataLayer push if form is deemed abandoned
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formBeforeunloadCall = function(){
          try {
            if (window.dataLayer && window.gtm_custom_helper.formChanged && !window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmit) {
              // push event to GTM
              var pagePathLast = {{DLV - pagePathLast}};
              window.dataLayer.push({
                'event' : 'custom.form.abandonment',
                'eventCategory' : 'form',
                'group' : window.gtm_custom_helper.formName,
                'eventLabel' : 'abandonment',
                'pagePathTarget' : pagePathLast && pagePathLast != 'no-value' ? pagePathLast : {{Page Path}} 
              });
            }
          } catch(err){};
        }
        // add addEventListener beforeunload event to call formBeforeunloadCall
        window.addEventListener('beforeunload', window.gtm_custom_helper.formBeforeunloadCall);
      }

      // check to see if a form is already active, if so clear listeners and call formBeforeunloadCall to trigger past form. This is in place for SAP route events
      if(typeof window.gtm_custom_helper.formActive != 'undefined' && window.gtm_custom_helper.formActive) {
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formActive.removeEventListener('change', window.gtm_custom_helper.formChangeCall);
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formActive.removeEventListener('submit', window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmitCall);
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formBeforeunloadCall();
      }
      // get a form from the page
      var form = {{CJS - Form - Element}};
      // reset form states
      window.gtm_custom_helper.formChanged = false;
      window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmit = false;
      window.gtm_custom_helper.formName = 'no-value';

      // if a form is found apply a name and assign listeners
      if(form && typeof form.addEventListener != 'undefined') {
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formName = 'no-name';
        if(typeof form.name != 'undefined' && form.name.length > 0) {
          window.gtm_custom_helper.formName = form.name;
        } else if(typeof form.id != 'undefined' && form.id.length > 0) {
          window.gtm_custom_helper.formName = form.id;
        }
        window.gtm_custom_helper.formActive = form;
        form.addEventListener('change', window.gtm_custom_helper.formChangeCall);
        form.addEventListener('submit', window.gtm_custom_helper.formSubmitCall);
      }
    }
  } catch(err){if({{Debug Mode}}) console.log('gtm', 'error', 'CHTML - dataLayer - Form Abandonment', err)};
})();
</script>

tag.name: CHTML - Scroll - Base
tag.notes:
Custom browser scroll listener script. The in-built GTM tigger is only able to track single pages (full browser reloads). This script will work with routeChange events and applies scroll depth tracking to all pages a user navigates to. 

This Tag is paused by default as scrolling can add significant events (hits) to Google Analytics. Please review current hit levels before activating this Tag.

parameter.value:
<script type="text/javascript" id="gtm-scroll-tracking">
/**
 * Emits events based on scrolling behavior in a given context. Shouldn't
 * be called until after DOMReady.
 *
 * @example
 * var scrollTracker = ScrollTracker({
 *   context: '#content'
 * });
 *
 * scrollTracker.on({
 *   percentage: {
 *    every: [25]
 *   }
 * }, function(evt) {
 *
 *   // Will trigger when the user reaches 25, 50, 75, & 100% depth
 *   notifySomeService(evt.data.scrollDepth);
 *
 * });
 *
 * Copyright(c) 2017 LunaMetrics, LLC.
 * Written by @notdanwilkerson
 * Licensed under the MIT License
 * For full license text, visit https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT
 */
(function(window) {

  'use strict';

  var document = window.document;

  /**
   * @constructor
   *
   * @param {object} [opts] options for the constructor
   * @param {HTMLElement} [opts.context] defaults to <body>
   * @param {number} [opts.minHeight] minimum height of context required to track
   *
   * @returns {ScrollTracker}
   */
  function ScrollTracker(opts) {
    if (!(this instanceof ScrollTracker)) return new ScrollTracker(opts);

    opts = opts || {};

    var context = opts.context || 'body';

    if (typeof context === 'string') context = document.querySelector(context);

    if (!context) throw new Error('Unable to find context ' + context);

    this._context = context;
    this.minHeight = opts.minHeight || 0;
    this._marks = {};
    this._tracked = {};
    this._trackedLabels = {};
    this._config = {
      percentages: {
        each: {},
        every: {}
      },
      pixels: {
        each: {},
        every: {}
      },
      elements: {
        each: {},
        every: {}
      }
    };

    var boundAndThrottledDepthCheck = throttle(this._checkDepth.bind(this), 500);
    var boundUpdate = this._update.bind(this);
    var throttledUpdate = throttle(boundUpdate, 500);

    window.addEventListener('scroll', boundAndThrottledDepthCheck, true);
    window.addEventListener('resize', throttledUpdate);

    this._artifacts = {
      timer: onDocHeightChange(boundUpdate),
      resize: throttledUpdate,
      scroll: boundAndThrottledDepthCheck
    };

  }

  /**
   * Cleans up timer and event bindings
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype.destroy = function() {

    clearInterval(this._artifacts._timer);
    window.removeEventListener('resize', this._artifacts.resize);
    window.removeEventListener('scroll', this._artifacts.scroll, true);

  };

  /**
   * Registers a handler for a given configuration
   *
   * @param {object} config
   * @param {object} [config.percentages]
   * @param {number[]} [config.percentages.each] tracks every 100 / n percentage
   * @param {number[]} [config.percentages.every] tracks each percentage once
   * @param {object} [config.pixels]
   * @param {number[]} [config.pixels.each] tracks every context.height() / n pixel depth
   * @param {number[]} [config.pixels.every] tracks each pixel depth once
   * @param {object} [config.elements]
   * @param {string[]} [config.elements.each] tracks every element that matches each selector
   * @param {string[]} [config.elements.every] tracks the first element that matches each selector
   * @param {function} handler
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype.on = function(config, handler) {

    var _config = this._config;

    ['percentages', 'pixels', 'elements'].forEach(function(type) {

      if (!config[type]) return;

      ['each', 'every'].forEach(function(freq) {

        if (!config[type][freq]) return;

        config[type][freq].forEach(function(key) {

          _config[type][freq][key] = _config[type][freq][key] || [];
          _config[type][freq][key].push(handler);

        });

      });

    });

    this._update();

  };

  /**
   * Checks marks and depth
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._update = function() {

    this._calculateMarks();
    this._checkDepth();

  };

  /**
   * Calculates the pixels for all configs
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._calculateMarks = function() {

    delete this._marks;
    this._fromTop = getNodeDistanceFromTop(this._context);
    this._marks = {};

    var _config = this._config;
    var contextHeight = this._contextHeight();
    var addMark = this._addMark.bind(this);
    var self = this;
    var elements,
      element,
      depth,
      key;

    if (contextHeight < this.minHeight) return;

    for (key in _config.percentages.every) {

      forEachIn({
        n: Number(key),
        numerator: 100,
        callback: percentagesEveryCallback(_config.percentages.every[key])
      });

    }

    for (key in _config.pixels.every) {

      forEachIn({
        n: Number(key),
        numerator: contextHeight,
        callback: pixelsEveryCallback(_config.pixels.every[key])
      });

    }

    for (key in _config.percentages.each) {

      depth = Math.floor(contextHeight * Number(key) / 100);

      addMark({
        label: key,
        depth: depth,
        handlers: _config.percentages.each[key]
      });

    }

    for (key in _config.pixels.each) {

      depth = Number(key);

      addMark({
        label: key,
        depth: depth,
        handlers: _config.pixels.each[key]
      });

    }

    for (key in _config.elements.every) {

      elements = [].slice.call(this._context.querySelectorAll(key));

      if (elements.length) {

        elements.forEach(elementsEveryCallback(key, _config.elements.every[key]));

      }

    }

    for (key in _config.elements.each) {

      element = this._context.querySelector(key);

      if (element) {

        depth = element.getBoundingClientRect().top -
          self._context.getBoundingClientRect().top;

        addMark({
          label: key,
          depth: depth,
          handlers: _config.elements.each[key]
        });

      }

    }

    /**
     * Callback for our everyElements iterations
     *
     * @param {string} key
     * @param {function[]} handlers
     *
     * @returns {everyElement~Callback}
     */
    function elementsEveryCallback(key, handlers) {

      /**
       * @callback everyElement~Callback
       *
       * @param {HTMLElement} element
       * @param {number} ind
       */
      return function(element, ind) {

        var depth = element.getBoundingClientRect().top -
           self._context.getBoundingClientRect().top;

        addMark({
          label: key + '[' + ind + ']',
          depth: depth,
          handlers: _config.elements.every[key]
        });

      };

    }


    /**
     * Builds a callback for our everyPercentages iterations
     *
     * @param {function[]} handlers
     *
     * @returns {everyPercentage~Callback}
     */
     function percentagesEveryCallback(handlers) {

       /**
        * @callback everyPercentage~Callback
        *
        * @param {number} n
        */
       return function(n) {

        var depth = Math.floor(n * contextHeight / 100);

        addMark({
          label: String(n),
          depth: depth,
          handlers: _config.percentages.every[key]
        });

      };

    }

    /**
     * Builds a callback for our everyPixels iterations
     *
     * @param {function[]} handlers
     *
     * @param {number} n
     */

    function pixelsEveryCallback(handlers) {

      /**
       * @callback everyPixel~Callback
       *
       * @param {function[]} handlers
       */
      return function(n) {

        var depth = n;

        addMark({
          label: String(depth),
          depth: depth,
          handlers: handlers
        });

      };

    }

  };

  /**
   * Checks all marks and triggers appropriate handlers
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._checkDepth = function() {
    var marks = this._marks;
    var currentDepth = this._currentDepth();
    var key;
    for (key in marks) {

      var targetLabel = this._trackedLabels[key];
      if(this._trackedLabels[targetLabel] == true) {
        this._tracked[key] = true;
      }
      if (currentDepth >= key && !this._tracked[key]) {

        marks[key].forEach(function(boundHandler) {
          boundHandler();
        });

        this._tracked[key] = true;
        this._trackedLabels[targetLabel] = true

      }

    }

  };

  /**
   * Resets the internal cache of tracked marks
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype.reset = function() {
    this._tracked = {};
    this._trackedLabels = {};
    this._marks = {};
    this._update();
  };

  /**
   * Returns the height of the scrolling context
   *
   * @returns {number}
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._contextHeight = function() {

    if (this._context !== document.body) return this._context.scrollHeight - 5;

    return this._context.clientHeight - 5;

  };

  /**
   * Returns the current depth we've scrolled into the context
   *
   * @returns {number}
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._currentDepth = function() {

    var isVisible = visibleInViewport(this._context);
    var depth;

    if (!this._context.scrollTop) {

      this._context.scrollTop = 1;

      if (!this._context.scrollTop) {

        depth = (window.pageYOffset ||
          document.documentElement.scrollTop ||
          document.body.scrollTop || 0) - this._fromTop;

      } else {

        this._context.scrollTop = 0;
        depth = this._context.scrollTop + isVisible;

      }

    } else {

      depth = this._context.scrollTop + isVisible;

    }

    if (!isVisible) {

      return depth >= this._fromTop ? depth : -1;

    }

    return depth + isVisible;

  };

  /**
   * Adds a mark to be tracked
   *
   * @param {object} config
   * @param {number} config.depth
   * @param {string} config.label
   * @param {function[]} config.handlers
   */
  ScrollTracker.prototype._addMark = function(config) {
    var depth = config.depth;
    // custom update - drd
    this._trackedLabels[depth] = config.label;
    if(typeof this._trackedLabels[config.label] == 'undefined') {
        this._trackedLabels[config.label] = false;
    }
    if(this._trackedLabels[config.label] == true){
        // don't add mark, this label has been tracked already
    } else {
        this._marks[depth] = (this._marks[depth] || []).concat(Mark(config));
    }
    

  };

  /**
   * @constructor
   * @private
   *
   * @param {object} config
   * @param {string} config.label
   * @param {number} config.depth
   * @param {function[]} config.handlers
   *
   * @returns {Mark}
   */
  function Mark(config) {

    /**
     * A Mark is an array of callbacks bound with their data payloads
     *
     * @name Mark
     *
     * @type {function[]}
     */
    return config.handlers.map(function(handler) {

      return handler.bind(this, {
        data: {
          depth: config.depth,
          label: config.label
        }
      });

    });

  }

  /**
   * Calls a callback function each time config.n goes into config.numerator
   *
   * @param {object} config
   * @param {number} config.n
   * @param {number} config.numerator
   * @param {function} config.callback
   */
  function forEachIn(config) {

    var len = Math.floor(config.numerator / config.n);
    var i;

    for (i = 1; i <= len; i++) {

      config.callback(i * config.n);

    }

  }

  /**
   * Helper that watches for changes in the height of the document
   */
  function onDocHeightChange(handler) {

    var documentHeight = docHeight();

    return setInterval(function() {

      if (docHeight() !== documentHeight) {

        handler();
        documentHeight = docHeight();

      }

    }, 500);

  }

  /**
   * Returns the height of the document
   *
   * @returns {number}
   */
  function docHeight() {

    var body = document.body;
    var html = document.documentElement;

    return Math.max(body.scrollHeight, body.offsetHeight,
      html.clientHeight, html.scrollHeight, html.offsetHeight);

  }

  /**
   * Returns the number of pixels of the element visible in the viewport
   * @param {HTMLElement} element
   *
   * @returns {number}
   * adapted from:
   * @link https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24768795/get-the-visible-height-of-a-div-with-jquery#answer-26831113
   */
  function visibleInViewport(element) {

    var height = element.offsetHeight;
    var windowHeight = viewportHeight();
    var rect = element.getBoundingClientRect();

    return Math.max(
      0,
      rect.top > 0 ? Math.min(height, windowHeight - rect.top) :
      (rect.bottom < windowHeight ? rect.bottom : windowHeight)
    );

  }

  /**
   * Returns the height of the viewport
   *
   * @returns {number}
   */
  function viewportHeight() {

    var elem = (document.compatMode === "CSS1Compat") ?
      document.documentElement :
      document.body;

    return elem.clientHeight;

  }

  /**
   * Retrieves the distance of a node from the top of the document
   *
   * @param {HTMLElement} node
   *
   * @returns {number}
   */
  function getNodeDistanceFromTop(node) {

    var nodeTop = node.getBoundingClientRect().top - (node.scrollHeight - node.clientHeight) / 2;
    // @link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/scrollX
    var docTop = (window.pageYOffset !== undefined) ?
      window.pageYOffset :
      (document.documentElement || document.body.parentNode || document.body).scrollTop;

    return nodeTop + docTop;

  }

  /**
   * Does nothing
   */
  function noop() {}

  /**
   * Throttle function borrowed from:
   * Underscore.js 1.5.2
   * http://underscorejs.org
   * (c) 2009-2013 Jeremy Ashkenas, DocumentCloud and Investigative Reporters & Editors
   * Underscore may be freely distributed under the MIT license.
   */
  function throttle(func, wait) {
    var context, args, result;
    var timeout = null;
    var previous = 0;
    var later = function() {
      previous = new Date;
      timeout = null;
      result = func.apply(context, args);
    };
    return function() {
      var now = new Date;
      if (!previous) previous = now;
      var remaining = wait - (now - previous);
      context = this;
      args = arguments;
      if (remaining <= 0) {
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = null;
        previous = now;
        result = func.apply(context, args);
      } else if (!timeout) {
        timeout = setTimeout(later, remaining);
      }
      return result;
    };
  }

  /**
   * Installs a noop'd version of ScrollTracker on the window
   */
  function installMock() {

    var fake = {};
    var key;

    for (key in ScrollTracker) {

      fake[key] = noop;

    }

    window.ScrollTracker = fake;

  }

  window.ScrollTracker = ScrollTracker;

})(this);
/*
 * v2.0.4
 * Created by the Google Analytics consultants at http://www.lunametrics.com/
 * Written by @notdanwilkerson
 * Documentation: https://github.com/lunametrics/gascroll/
 * Licensed under the MIT License
 */
  /*
 * This section of the code handles setting up scroll tracking for GTM
 */
(function(window) {
  var thresholds = {{Const - Scroll - Thresholds [EDIT ME]}} || ""
  thresholds = thresholds.split(",").map(function(t){ return parseInt(t, 10) })
  
  try {
    var init = function() {
      try {
        window.gtm_scroll_tracker = window.ScrollTracker();
        window.gtm_scroll_tracker.on({
          percentages: {
            //every: [50]
            each: thresholds
          }
        }, function(evt) {
          dataLayer.push({
            'event': 'custom.scrollTracking',
            'gtm.scrollThreshold' : evt.data.label,
            'gtm.scrollDirection' : 'vertical',
            'gtm.scrollUnits' : 'percent'
          });
        });
        delete window.ScrollTracker;
      } catch(err) {};
    }

    if (document.readyState !== 'loading') {
        init();
    } else {
      document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', init);
    }

  } catch(err) {};
  
})(window);
</script>

<script >
    (function() {
        var _video_milestones = {{Const - Video progress - Thresholds [EDIT ME]}} || "";
        _video_milestones = _video_milestones.split(",").map(function(t){ return parseInt(t, 10) })
  
        var _video_type = "vimeo";
        var _asInitiateVideoTracking = function() {
            var _asSendHit = function() {
                return function(_asData) {
                    if (_asData.videoTitle === "not set") return;
                    var _asThereIsHitValue = _asData.hitValue;
                    var _asHitObject;
                    var _eventData = _asData.eventType ? _asData.eventType.split('.') : [];
                    var _eventAction = _eventData && _eventData.length > 0 ? _eventData[_eventData.length-1] : 'unknown';
                    if (_asThereIsHitValue) _asHitObject = {
                        "event": _asData.eventType,
                        "eventCategory": "video",
                        "eventAction": _eventAction,
                        "eventLabel": _asData.videoTitle,
                        "eventValue": _asData.hitValue,
                        "nonInteraction": _asData.nonInteraction,
                        "type": _video_type,
                        "gtm.videoStatus" : _eventAction,
                        "gtm.videoPercent" : _asData.hitValue
                    };
                    else _asHitObject = {
                        "event" : _asData.eventType,
                        "eventCategory": "video",
                        "eventAction": _eventAction,
                        "eventLabel": _asData.videoTitle,
                        "nonInteraction": _asData.nonInteraction,
                        "type": _video_type,
                        "gtm.videoStatus" : _eventAction
                    };
                    dataLayer.push(_asHitObject);
                }
            }();

            function _asGetVimeoIframes() {
                _asVimeoIframes = Array.prototype.filter.call(document.getElementsByTagName("iframe"), function(iframe) {
                    return /player.vimeo.com/.test(iframe.src)
                })
            }

            function _asExtendFunctions(_asObj, _asMethods) {
                for (var _asKey in _asMethods) _asObj[_asKey] =
                    _asMethods[_asKey]
            }

            function _asEmbedVimeoAPI() {
                var Vimeo = window.Vimeo;
                if (_asVimeoIframes.length > 0) {
                    var _asVimeoApiExists = typeof Vimeo !== "undefined";
                    if (!_asVimeoApiExists) {
                        var x = document.createElement("script");
                        var r = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
                        x.async = true;
                        x.type = "text/javascript";
                        x.src = "https://player.vimeo.com/api/player.js";
                        r.parentNode.insertBefore(x, r)
                    }
                    _asApiInterval = window.setInterval(_asCheckForIframeAPI, 1E3)
                }
            }

            function _asCheckForIframeAPI() {
                var Vimeo = window.Vimeo;
                if (typeof Vimeo !==
                    "undefined") {
                    window.clearInterval(_asApiInterval);
                    _asVimeoIframes.map(_asProcessIframeToVideo);
                    return
                }
                if (_asApiCurrentTime < 5) _asApiCurrentTime++;
                else window.clearInterval(_asApiInterval)
            }
            var _asVideoObjectAdditions = {
                setMilestones: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    var checkDurationSet = window.setInterval(function() {
                            var _asVidLen = _this._asData.videoLength;
                            if (_asVidLen !== "not set") {
                                _this._asData.milestones = _this._asData.milestones.map(function(milestone) {
                                    return milestone / 100 * _asVidLen
                                });
                                window.clearInterval(checkDurationSet)
                            }
                        },
                        200, _this)
                },
                setVideoTitle: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    this.getVideoTitle().then(function(videoTitle) {
                        _this._asData.videoTitle = videoTitle
                    })
                },
                replayOrNewVid: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    this._asData.milestones = _video_milestones;
                    this.getVideoTitle().then(function(videoTitle) {
                        if (_this._asData.videoTitle === videoTitle) {
                            _this._asData.justFinished = false;
                            _this.setMilestones()
                        } else _this._vidLoaded();
                        _this._vidPlay()
                    })
                },
                setVideoLength: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    this.getDuration().then(function(videoDuration) {
                        _this._asData.videoLength =
                            Math.round(videoDuration)
                    })
                },
                _asGetCurrentTime: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    this.getCurrentTime().then(function(seconds) {
                        _this._asData.currentTime = seconds
                    })
                },
                _vidLoaded: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    this.setVideoTitle();
                    this.setVideoLength();
                    this.setMilestones();
                    this.getVolume().then(function(volume) {
                        if (volume === 0) _this._asData.justMuted = true
                    });
                    var _asTitleExist = setInterval(function() {
                        if (_this._asData.videoTitle !== "not set") {
                            //_this._sendHit("custom.video.loaded", true);
                            clearInterval(_asTitleExist)
                        }
                    }, 75);
                    this._asData.justFinished =
                        false;
                    this._asData.vidLoaded = true
                },
                _vidPlay: function() {
                    if (_asDebounceSeek) return;
                    var _this = this;
                    window.setTimeout(function() {
                        if (_asDebounceSeek) return;
                        if (_this._asData.justFinished && _this._asData.firstPlay) {
                            _this.replayOrNewVid();
                            return
                        }
                        var _asPlay = _this._asData.firstPlay ? ["custom.video.start", "custom.video.autoplay"] : "custom.video.resume";
                        if (_asPlay.length === 2) {
                            _this._asData.firstPlay = false;
                            _this._asData.autoplay ? _this._sendHit(_asPlay[1], true) : _this._sendHit(_asPlay[0], false)
                        } else _this._sendHit(_asPlay, false)
                    }, 1E3, _this)
                },
                _vidPause: function() {
                    var _this = this;
                    if (_this._asData.justFinished || _asDebounceSeek) return;
                    window.setTimeout(function() {
                        if (_this._asData.justFinished || _asDebounceSeek) return;
                        if (_this.getCurrentTime() !== _this._asData.videoLength) _this._sendHit("custom.video.pause", false)
                    }, 1E3, _this)
                },
                _vidSeek: function() {
                    if (_asDebounceSeek || this._asData.justFinished) return;
                    _asDebounceSeek = true;
                    this._sendHit("custom.video.seek", false);
                    window.setTimeout(function() {
                        _asDebounceSeek = false
                    }, 2E3)
                },
                _vidComplete: function() {
                    if (this._asData.milestones.length >
                        0)
                        for (var i = 0; i < this._asData.milestones.length; i++) {
                            var _asMilestone = this._asData.milestones[i];
                            var _asCurrentPercent = _asMilestone / this._asData.videoLength * 100;
                            if (!Number.isNaN(_asCurrentPercent) && _asCurrentPercent % 25 === 0 && _asCurrentPercent > 0 && _asCurrentPercent <= 100) {
                                this._asData.hitValue = _asCurrentPercent;
                                this._sendHit(decodeURIComponent(encodeURIComponent("custom.video.progress")), true)
                            }
                        }
                    this._asData.hitValue = 100;
                    this._sendHit("custom.video.complete", true);
                    this._asData.firstPlay = true;
                    this._asData.justFinished =
                        true;
                    this._asData.autoplay = false
                },
                _vidMilestones: function(data) {
                    if (_asDebounceMilestone) return;
                    _asDebounceMilestone = true;
                    window.setTimeout(function() {
                        _asDebounceMilestone = false
                    }, 2E3);
                    if (this._asData.firstPlay && data.seconds > 3) this._vidPlay();
                    if (data.seconds < this._asData.milestones[0] || this._asData.milestones.length === 0) return;
                    var _asTime = data.seconds;
                    var _asMilestone;
                    do _asMilestone = this._asData.milestones.splice(0, 1)[0]; while (_asMilestone > _asTime);
                    var _asCurrentPercent = _asMilestone / this._asData.videoLength *
                        100;
                    if (!Number.isNaN(_asCurrentPercent) && _asCurrentPercent % 25 === 0 && _asCurrentPercent > 0 && _asCurrentPercent <= 100) {
                        this._asData.hitValue = _asCurrentPercent;
                        this._sendHit(decodeURIComponent(encodeURIComponent('custom.video.progress')), true)
                    }
                },
                _vidMuted: function(data) {
                    if (this._asData.justMuted === false && data.volume === 0) {
                        this._asData.justMuted = true;
                        this._sendHit("custom.video.mute", false)
                    } else if (this._asData.justMuted && data.volume > 0) {
                        this._asData.justMuted = false;
                        this._sendHit("custom.video.unmute", false)
                    }
                },
                _vidFullScreen: function() {
                    if (document.fullscreenElement ||
                        document.mozFullScreen || document.webkitIsFullScreen || document.msFullscreenElement || document.fullScreen) this._sendHit("custom.video.fullscreen", false)
                },
                _sendHit: function(ev, ni) {
                    this._asData.eventType = ev;
                    this._asData.nonInteraction = ni;
                    this._asData.hitValue = ev.match(/progress|complete/i) ? this._asData.hitValue : null;
                    _asSendHit(this._asData)
                },
                setListeners: function() {
                    this.on("play", function() {
                        this._vidPlay()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("pause", function() {
                        this._vidPause()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("seeked", function() {
                        this._vidSeek()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("ended", function() {
                        this._vidComplete()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("timeupdate", function(data) {
                        this._vidMilestones(data)
                    }, true);
                    this.on("volumechange", function(data) {
                        this._vidMuted(data)
                    }, true);
                    this.on("fullscreenchange", function() {
                        this._vidFullScreen()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("webkitfullscreenchange", function() {
                        this._vidFullScreen()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("mozfullscreenchange", function() {
                        this._vidFullScreen()
                    }, true);
                    this.on("msfullscreenchange", function() {
                        this._vidFullScreen()
                    }, true)
                }
            };

            function _asProcessIframeToVideo(iframe) {
                var Vimeo =
                    window.Vimeo;
                var _asVideo = new Vimeo.Player(iframe);
                _asVideo._asData = {
                    eventType: undefined,
                    videoTitle: "not set",
                    videoPlayer: "Vimeo_iframe",
                    videoLength: "not set",
                    videosrc: iframe.src,
                    milestones: _video_milestones,
                    firstPlay: true,
                    autoplay: iframe.src.indexOf("autoplay=1") !== -1,
                    justSeeked: false,
                    justFinished: false,
                    justMuted: false,
                    vidLoaded: false,
                    nonInteraction: null,
                    hitValue: 0
                };
                _asExtendFunctions(_asVideo, _asVideoObjectAdditions);
                _asVideo.setListeners();
                _asVideos.push(_asVideo);
                _asVideo._vidLoaded();
                iframe._asProcessed =
                    true
            }

            function _asInfiniteScrollGetVids() {
                function getdocheight() {
                    var b = document.body,
                        e = document.documentElement;
                    return document.height || Math.max(Math.max(b.scrollHeight, e.scrollHeight), Math.max(b.offsetHeight, e.offsetHeight), Math.max(b.clientHeight, e.clientHeight))
                }
                var _asMaxHeight = getdocheight();
                window.setInterval(function() {
                    var _asBufferHeight = 100;
                    var _asCurrentHeight = Math.max(_asMaxHeight, getdocheight());
                    if (_asCurrentHeight > _asMaxHeight + _asBufferHeight) {
                        _asMaxHeight = _asCurrentHeight;
                        _asGetVimeoIframes();
                        _asVimeoIframes.map(function(iframe) {
                            if (!iframe._asProcessed) _asProcessIframeToVideo(iframe)
                        })
                    }
                }, 3E3)
            }

            var _asVideos = [];
            var _asApiInterval;
            var _asApiCurrentTime = 0;
            var _asVimeoIframes;
            var _asDebounceSeek = false;
            var _asDebounceMilestone = false;

            if(typeof window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker == 'undefined') {
                window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker = {};
            }
            window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideos = function(){

                _asVideos = [];
                _asVimeoIframes = undefined;
                clearInterval(_asApiInterval);
                _asDebounceSeek = false;
                _asDebounceMilestone = false;

                //console.log("_asCheckForVideos()")
                if(typeof window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideosInterval != 'undefined'){
                    //console.log("clear existing _asCheckForVideos()")
                    clearInterval(window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideosInterval);
                }
                window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideosInterval = setInterval(function() {
                    //console.log("check iframes")
                    _asGetVimeoIframes();
                    if (_asVimeoIframes.length > 0) {
                        //console.log("video found, clear")
                        clearInterval(window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideosInterval);
                        _asEmbedVimeoAPI()
                    }
                }, 500);
                setTimeout(function() {
                     //console.log("video timeout clear")
                    clearInterval(window.gtm_video_vimeo_tracker._asCheckForVideosInterval)
                }, 3000);
            }
            /*setTimeout(function() {
                    _asInfiniteScrollGetVids()
            }, 5E3)*/
        }
        _asInitiateVideoTracking();
    })(); 
</script>

<script>
(function(){
	try {
		if(typeof window.gtm_scroll_tracker != 'undefined') {
			var tracked = gtm_scroll_tracker._tracked;
			var count = 0;
			for (key in tracked) {
				count += 1;
			}
			if(count > 0) {
				window.gtm_scroll_tracker.reset();
			}
		}
	} catch(err){};
})();
</script>

map.value: {{URL - Hostname - no www - from Click URL}}
{{URL - Hostname - no www - from Click URL}}

trigger.name: Click - Link - Search Result [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets search result links <a>.

trigger.name: Page View - All Pages - with search query [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace 'q' with whatever the search query param name is used by your website
3) If your website uses more than one query param for search, you can enter them as a regular expression like so: (q|search|etc)=

trigger.name: Click - Link - Social Media [EDIT ME]

parameter.value: {{URL - Hostname - no www - from Click URL}}

trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) Customise the condition by adding or removing hostnames for social media sites according to your needs. Ensure each is pipe separated without spaces.

trigger.name: Click - Link - Footer [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above 
2) In the condition field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets link elements <a> in the website footer.

trigger.name: Page - DOM Ready - Page Not Found
CE - custom.video - start progress complete seek pause
Click - Link - Header [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets link elements <a> in the website header.

trigger.name: Click - Link - CTA [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets link elements <a> that look like buttons. Note this wont work with <button> elements.

trigger.name: Click - Link - Breadcrumb [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that matches the individual breadcrumb <a> elements

trigger.name: History Change - with search query [EDIT ME]
trigger.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the condition field, replace 'q' with whatever the search query param name is used by your website
3) If your website uses more than one query param for search, you can enter them as a regular expression like so: (q|search|etc)=

variable.name: Const - Body Content - CSS Selector [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets the HTML element that holds the body content (i.e. that excludes the site header/footer). This needs to work on all pages of the website.

variable.name: CJS - Word Count
variable.notes: Groups word count into groups of 500 word increments

variable.name: CJS - Word Count Range
variable.notes: Groups word count into groups of 500 word increments

variable.name: CJS - URL - Query + Fragment
variable.notes: Return the combination of the current url query string (?) and anchor/fragment (#) if they exist in the current page url. Google Analytics will strip anchors and in some cases filter the query strings from reports. This variable is used to populate a custom dimension if this data needs to be preserved.

variable.name: Const - GA4 - Measurement ID - Test [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace G-0000000001 with the Google Analytics 4 Measurement ID for your TESTING property.

variable.name: CJS - Host | Debug
variable.notes: Combines the current website host name with GTM's flag for preview mode. The returned value can then be used to determine the difference between Prod/UAT environments events and when GTM is in testing mode. Very handy to prevent tracking from going into live accounts while testing.

variable.name: Const - GA4 - Measurement ID - Prod [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace G-0000000000 with the Google Analytics 4 Measurement ID for your PRODUCTION property.

variable.name: LTR - Hostname To Measurement ID [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the second row of the lookup table, replace 'www.mywebsite.com' with the domain name of your website (ensure to preserve "host=" at the beginning and to preserve "www." in your domain name)
4) If you need to match additional domains or subdomains, make use of regex, for example: host=(www.mywebsite.com|subdomain.mywebsite.com)
3) If you have other environments such as staging/testing you can add more rows to the table, and set the output to also use the TEST property

variable.name: Const - Template - Version
variable.notes: This should only be edited by Jellyfish

variable.name: URL - Query - search term [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the Query Key field, replace q with the relevant query param name used by your website for site search.

variable.name: Const - Page Not Found - CSS Selector [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets the element that contains the 404 not found message on your 404 pages.

variable.name: Const - Page Not Found - Text [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace 'page not found' with the text we should look for in the page title to know this is a 404 page, e.g. "404 not found". If this text is not found in the title, then we will look for it in the element specified by "Const - Page Not Found - CSS Selector".

variable.name: CJS - Page - 404
variable.notes: This custom script attempts to identify the current page as a 404 error page. It will first review the document.title (browser page title) for expected matches from the configuration variables. If no match is found it will attempt to use the css selector configuration to read off the html targeted elements. This is used as part of a trigger condition to fire a 404 page load event.

variable.name: URL - File Extension - from Click URL
CJS - Form - Name
variable.notes: This script will evaluate the current form element, looking to provide a friendly reporting label. It will first attempt to use the name attribute, then a id, otherwise the forms parent html element classes.

variable.name: Const - Form - CSS Selector [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets a single primary form on the page - this should work on any page of your website. You may enter multiple selectors as long as they are comma separated.

variable.name: CJS - Form - Element
variable.notes: This script will use the configured form css selector variable to find the first form matched on the current page. It will only return the first match.

variable.name: CJS - Click - Label
variable.notes: A custom script to improve the identification and labeling of html elements clicked on the website. Not all buttons on a website have click text e.g. images. This script provides a fallback for elements that do not have a value for the click text. It will search for known attributes and child elements for fall backs. This will not cover all cases but greatly improves the labeling for clicked elements.

variable.name: LTR - Scrolling - Activated Pages [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

This is to enable which pages of your website should capture scroll events in GA4. You can use regular expressions to easily capture whole sections, or more granular paths to capture specific pages.

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) Replace .*my-page-path with a valid regex depending on your needs
3) Add as many rows as you need - remember to always set the output value to yes
4) Any pages that do no match any of the rows in the table, will not track scroll events

variable.name: LT - GA4 - Event Name by VideoStatus
URL - Hostname - no www - from Click URL
CJS - Click - URL - Type
variable.notes: This script will extract the current targeted click url hostname and compare it to the current website hostname. It will then determine if the clicked url is an internal,subdomain or external link.

variable.name: Const - Breadcrumb Items - CSS Selector [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Trigger Configuration above
2) In the value field, replace .pretend-css-selector with the CSS selector that targets the breadcrumb items. This will be used to find all the breadcrumbs items on the page. Note this selector should not just target <a> elements, because the tail element is something not a link.

variable.name: Const - Scroll - Thresholds [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) Replace the current percentage values with ones that suit your needs
3) Ensure they are comma separated and do not include the % sign

variable.name: Const - Video progress - Thresholds [EDIT ME]
variable.notes:
INSTRUCTIONS

1) Edit the Variable Configuration above
2) Replace the current percentage values with ones that suit your needs - keep in mind that 100% will already be covered by a separate complete event
3) Ensure they are comma separated and do not include the % sign
